basis: The user explicitly commits to the ultra-tiny water step and a 10-minute check-in, with safety/voluntary boundaries, indicating a high likelihood of following the suggested action.
cognitive_dissonance: The user experiences tension between environmental influence and personal boundaries, balancing social-eating concerns with a concrete micro-action.
negative_thought_patterns: Environmental overwhelm, self-doubt about eating around others, all-or-nothing thinking at times.
emotional_triggers: Social eating pressure, fear of losing control, discomfort in around others, hot weather context.
coaching_notes: Keep leveraging ultra-tiny, on-your-terms steps. After the 10-minute check-in, invite the user to name bodily signals (hunger, fullness, fatigue) and mood. Reinforce safety cues and autonomy; gradually introduce optional tiny bites only when clearly voluntary and safe.
